frame.name: FR_Justifying
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Speaker</fen> provides a <fen>Sufficient_reason</fen> to an <fen>Addressee</fen> for considering that an <fen>Eventuality</fen> (event or state) is licit or legitimate. In most cases, the <fen>Speaker</fen> is responsible for the <fen>Eventuality</fen> to take place or not to take place. But this is not a requirement (contrary to fn 1.5 Justifying frame), cf. the contrast: <ex>Kim failed to fully <t>justify</t> <fex name="Eventuality">his decision</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Speaker">Smithers</fex> <t>defended</t> <fex name="Eventuality">Jane's decision</fex> by insisting that she had used her best judgment</ex> <ex></ex>
In cases like this last example, a <fen>Responsible_entity</fen> may be expressed instead of the <fen>Eventuality</fen>. In those cases, the <fen>Speaker</fen> seeks to provide a <fen>Sufficient_reason</fen> for the <fen>Responsible_entity</fen> to have brought about the <fen>Eventuality</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Speaker">Smithers</fex> <t>defended</t> <fex name="Responsible_entity">Jane</fex> by insisting that she had used her best judgment</ex> <ex></ex>
The <fen>Addressee</fen> deems the <fen>Eventuality</fen> to constitute a violation of an obligation or a moral guideline. The <fen>Addressee</fen> is conceptually present, but is often not locally expressed.
<ex></ex> <asf>Relation to fndata-1.5</asf> : this frame is a modification of the Justifying frame. The Responsible_entity FE has been added. The Act and State-of-affairs FEs have been merged into the <fen>Eventuality</fen> FE. The <fen>Speaker</fen> is not necessarily directly responsible for the <fen>Eventuality</fen>. The <fen>Sufficient_reason</fen> is Core. The <fen>Judge</fen> FE is renamed <fen>Addressee</fen>.
<ex></ex>
Distinctions with other frames:
<ex></ex> ≠ <frframe>FR_Attempt_suasion.legitimacy</frframe>: In FR_Justifying, the Action or State_of_affairs the Communicator is trying to show as legitimate is considered to be known as true and to have happened or at least been decided already, whereas in FR_Attempt_suasion.legitimacy, the Persuader is trying to present a future action or state of affairs as legitimate.
<ex></ex> ≠ <frframe>FR_Attributing_cause</frframe>: in FR_Justifying, the justification does not necessarily entails that the <fen>Sufficient_reason</fen> did or would actually cause the <fen>Act</fen> or <fen>State_of_affairs</fen>, the key point being that the <fen>Sufficient_reason</fen> is sufficient for considering them as legitimate. This frame is linked to the FR_Deserving frame : in the latter, the LUs state the relation between the Sufficient_reason and the State_of_affairs or Act, without any Speaker.
</def-root>

FE.name: Speaker
FE.definition:
<def-root>The person or organization who communicates the <fen>Sufficient_reason</fen> for the <fen>Eventuality</fen> to occur / have occurred.
<ex><fex name="Speaker">Smithers</fex> <t>defended</t> his decision by insisting that he had used his best judgment</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Sufficient_reason
FE.definition:
<def-root>The set of facts or circumstances that the <fen>Speaker</fen> offers to consider the <fen>Eventuality</fen> as licit or legitimate.
<ex>Mr De Klerk <t>justified</t> his decision <fex name="Sufficient_reason">on the curious grounds that an inquiry would take too long</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Eventuality
FE.definition:
<def-root>An action or state of affairs for which the <fen>Speaker</fen> provides a reason to consider it as legitimate. It is often something for which the <fen>Speaker</fen> is held directly responsible, frequently an action that the <fen>Speaker</fen> has taken themself.
<ex>Kim failed to fully <t>justify</t> <fex name="Eventuality">his decision</fex>.</ex> <ex> The lawyers tried to <t>justify</t> <fex name="Eventuality">enormous punitive damages being paid to victims on a first-past-the-post system</fex> .</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Addressee
FE.definition:
<def-root>The person or institution that holds the <fen>Speaker</fen> responsible for an <fen>Act</fen> or <fen>State_of_affairs</fen>, and to whom the <fen>Speaker</fen> provides a <fen>Sufficient_reason</fen>.
<ex> Any decision that preparation and presentation should be separate would have to be <t>justified</t> <fex name="Addressee">to the public</fex> and be open in the last resort to judicial review</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Medium
FE.definition: <def-root>The physical entity or channel used to communicate can be expressed.</def-root>

FE.name: Responsible_entity
FE.definition: <def-root>A party or individual (generally considered responsible of an <fen>Eventuality</fen>) whose actions the <fen>Speaker</fen> seeks to legitimize.</def-root>
